bar.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a place where alcoholic drinks are served
bar.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The hotel has a licensed bar.
bar.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: one of the rooms inside a pub
bar.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a counter where alcoholic drinks are served
bar.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a small block of solid material that is longer than it is wide
bar.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a length of metal or wood put across a door, window etc to keep it shut or to prevent people going in or out
bar.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: houses with bars across the windows
bar.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: a group of notes and rests, separated from other groups by vertical lines, into which a line of written music is divided
bar.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: a few bars of the song
bar.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: a long narrow shape along the sides or at the top of a computer screen, usually containing signs that you can click on
bar.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: the main menu bar at the top of the screen
bar.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: the long piece of wood or metal across the top of the goal in sports such as football
bar.translation[0].definitions[8].defini: a long pile of sand or stones under the water at the entrance to a harbour
bar.translation[0].definitions[9].defini: a narrow band of colour or light
bar.translation[0].definitions[10].defin: a narrow band of metal or cloth worn on a military uniform to show rank
bar.translation[0].definitions[11].defin: the part of an electric heater that provides heat and has a red light
bar.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 3:
bar.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: He asked her to meet him in a trendy wine bar.
We met up in the student coffee bar.
I usually get some lunch from the sandwich bar.
The kids all hang out at the local burger bar.
The leisure centre also has a restaurant and a juice bar.
Have you tried that new sushi bar in town?
Madrid is full of great tapas bars.
When you’ve chosen your pizza, please help yourself from the salad bar.
bar.translation[0].note_box[1].sections[: bar
a place where people go to buy and drink alcoholic drinks
A man went into a bar and ordered a drink.
Let’s meet up in the hotel bar.
The city centre is full of wine bars and restaurants.
The club has a restaurant and a cocktail bar.
pub
a building in Britain where alcohol can be bought and drunk, and where meals are often served
Do you fancy going to the pub?
a country pub
public house
a pub
The fight took place outside a public house in the city centre.
somebody’s local
a pub near where you live, especially one you often go to
The Red Lion’s my local.
inn
a small hotel or pub, especially an old one in the countryside – often used in the name of the hotel or pub
The Bull Inn dates back to the 15th century.
The hotel was once a 17th century coaching inn  (=used by people travelling by coach and horses).
gastropub
a pub that is known to serve very good food
a gastropub with a riverside restaurant
the Windmill Gastropub
tavern
a pub in the past where you could also stay the night – used nowadays in the names of some pubs
the Turf Tavern
Marlowe was killed in a fight in a tavern.
watering hole
a bar, pub etc where people drink alcohol – often used humorously. A watering hole is also the name for a place where wild animals go to drink
The bar became a popular watering hole for journalists.
What’s your favorite watering hole?
dive
a bar, club etc that is cheap and dirty
The place is a bit of dive.
honky-tonk
a cheap bar where country music is played
They played in every honky-tonk in Tennessee.
saloon
a bar in the western United States. Also used in Britain about the part of a pub which has comfortable chairs where you can sit and relax
I felt like a cowboy walking into a saloon in the Wild West.
Do you want to stay in the saloon, or would rather go into the other bar?
people who work in a bar
barman
a man who serves drinks in a bar
A big Irish barman pulled me a pint of beer.
barmaid
a woman who serves drinks in a bar
I was working in the evenings as a barmaid.
bartender
someone who makes, pours, and serves drinks in a bar or restaurant
The bartender gave him his change.
bar staff
the people serving drinks or food in a bar or pub
The local pub is advertising for bar staff.
landlord
a man who owns or manages a pub
He became violent and the landlord asked him to leave.
bar.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to officially prevent someone from entering a place or from doing something
bar.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: They seized his passport and barred him from leaving the country.
bar.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to prevent people from going somewhere by placing something in their way
bar.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: She ran back, but Francis barred her way.
A locked gate barred my entrance to the wood.
bar.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to shut a door or window using a bar or piece of wood so that people cannot get in or out
bar.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: We had recorded the whole album, bar one track.
bar.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: the profession of being a barrister, or the members of this profession
bar.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: He retired after 25 years at the Bar.
bar.translation[3].definitions[1].defini: the profession of being a lawyer, or the members of this profession
bar.translation[3].definitions[2].defini: the exam that you must take to become a lawyer
bar.translation[4].definitions[0].defini: to officially stop someone from doing something or from entering a place
bar.translation[4].definitions[0].exampl: He has been barred from the securities and investment advisory business.
Foreign investors would be barred from buying majority stakes.
bar.translation[5].definitions[0].defini: the profession of a BARRISTER, or barristers in general
bar.translation[5].definitions[0].exampl: In 1988, she was called to the bar (=became a barrister) and she now practises in London, specialising in criminal and family law.
He has now passed his Bar Examination (=the examination you must pass in order to become a barrister).
bar.translation[5].definitions[1].defini: a word for the legal profession, used in the names of professional associations of lawyers
bar.translation[5].definitions[1].exampl: the New Jersey State Bar Association
